intro: Indigofera rostrata subsp. namaachensis, commonly known as the Namibian indigo, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces pods that contain lens-shaped seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
